str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and spao; to drag forth, i.e. unsheathe, or relatively retire.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A sword. Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of mache; a knife, i.e. Dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To smite, strike (as with a sword), smite to death, afflict. Probably prolongation from paio; to knock.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take away, smite off. From apo and haireomai; to remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An ear. Diminutive of ous; an earlet, i.e. One of the ears, or perhaps the lobe of the ear.
